alert.note: Alert for Central Mountains; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Wasatch Plateau, Book Cliffs; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 12 at 3:50PM MST until January 15 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Total storm accumulation of 2 to 4 feet, locally up to 5 feet Ogden area mountains and upper Cottonwoods. Winds will be quite strong, with gusts in excess of 50 mph near 9000 feet, in excess of 80 mph along exposed ridgelines through tonight. Significant blowing and drifting of snow is likely in exposed areas. * WHERE...Wasatch Mountains I-80 North, Wasatch Mountains South of I-80, Western Uinta Mountains, Wasatch Plateau/Book Cliffs and Central Mountains. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Widespread winter driving conditions are expected. Prepare for possible traction restrictions and potential closures for avalanche mitigation in prone areas. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov.
